theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on protein misfolding, decline in protein quality control systems (HSR, UPR), and accumulation of toxic aggregates driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteostasis failure including proteasome decline and accumulation of damaged proteins as a hallmark of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-associated collapse of proteostasis network leading to misfolded protein accumulation and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details progressive deterioration of protein homeostasis networks causing accumulation of damaged proteins and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights role of HSP70 chaperone system in disaggregating proteins and maintaining proteostasis to slow aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of hyper-stable protein aggregates due to proteostasis network decline driving aging and inflammation.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Links aging-related proteostasis decline and lysosomal dysfunction to impaired clearance and propagation of protein aggregates.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related impairment of ubiquitin-proteasome pathway and proteasome-mediated degradation contributing to protein accumulation.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows loss of protein homeostasis and accumulation of insoluble protein aggregates causally limiting lifespan.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in multiple protein quality control systems (HSR, UPR, autophagy, UPS) causing proteostasis collapse and aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline of proteostasis networks (UPR, UPS, autophagy) as conserved causal determinants of aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes aging-related impairment of molecular chaperones and their role in maintaining protein folding and preventing aggregation.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progressive failure of proteostasis network including chaperones and degradation systems driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Protein Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links proteostasis stress from nutritional status and chaperone induction to aging via protein homeostasis disruption.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in unfolded protein response in ER (UPRER) impairing proteostasis and shortening lifespan.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights proteostasis decline in stem cells as a fundamental aging mechanism affecting tissue maintenance and longevity.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of damaged proteins due to decline in temporal and spatial protein quality control with aging.
